Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Kaisa, you'll need to configure Eclipse for Java 1.4 compliance to get rid =
of the assert errors (prior to Java 1.4 'assert' was not a keyword but curr=
ently Eclipse defaults 1.3).
 
This can be done by going into "Window>Prefe=
rences>Java/Compiler>Compliance and Classfiles" and setting "Compiler compl=
iance level" to 1.4.
Make sure the 'Use default compliance level' is UNCHEC=
KED and that the 'Generated .class files compatibility' and 'Source compati=
blity' are also set to 1.4.
 
That should fix this problem.
 
- Kris
 
P.s.=
 Stack, I know there is an issue in the faq for this, but it could be clear=
er. I also think that this is short enough to be included directly, rather =
then linking to the list.
 
-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Kai=
sa Kaunonen
Sent: 6. j=C3=BAl=C3=AD 2005 09:05
To: archive-crawler@yahoogro=
ups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: Maven failed: IdentityCachingMapTest=




I got Heritrix compiled with Maven and now the crawler is running too.
=
Thanks for your help.

I also imported Heritrix into Eclipse. It=C3=A2=E2=
=82=AC=E2=84=A2 a great visual way
to see structure of the whole software. =
(Although I don=C3=A2=E2=82=AC=E2=84=A2t think
it=C3=A2=E2=82=AC=E2=84=A2s =
a good idea to try compile or run Heritrix from Eclipse.
Now for example it=
 reports an error on every =C3=A2=E2=82=AC=CB=9Cassert=C3=A2=E2=82=AC=E2=84=
=A2
statement in the code.) Maybe one should just edit the source in
Eclips=
e and compile it with Maven.
